name: Eddy

aboutpara: I'm Eddy Guerra John, a dedicated Computer Science student at the University of Houston-Downtown, specializing in software engineering. My journey has taken me through internships at top institutions, including the University of California, Berkeley, where I developed and optimized cryptographic algorithms, and NSF REU programs, where I honed my skills in machine learning and cybersecurity. My passion lies in building efficient, scalable software solutions, with a strong focus on algorithms and system design. I'm committed to pushing the limits of technology and am always excited to take on challenging projects that drive innovation.

resume.description: I have delivered world-class user experiences to millions of people. Well-versed with React, Javascript, and most of the Web frameworks.

experiences.position: Cryptographer at University of California Berkeley
experiences.bullets:
Developed and coded a cryptographic multi-signature protocol algorithm under the guidance of a senior 
professor, Optimized the commitment scheme within the algorithm reducing operational costs by minimizing the number 
of necessary operations

experiences.position: Edge Computing and Machine Learning Research Intern at Texas State University
experiences.bullets:
Trained and optimized AWS DeepRacer using reinforcement learning algorithms focusing on reward functions 
and performance enhancement, Conducted multi-agent artificial intelligence research on DeepRacer interactions, collaborating on 
implementation and troubleshooting to improve models, Documented research rigorously achieving successful publication and presentation in Washington D.C
